prompt_engine.description:
üöÄ PROMPT ENGINE: Expands prompt templates and returns structured instructions for you to follow.

Retrieves prompt by ID ‚Üí fills arguments ‚Üí applies methodology context ‚Üí returns prepared prompt.

SYNTAX: >>prompt_id key="value" | Chain: >>s1 --> >>s2 (N-1 arrows for N steps)
OPERATORS: @Framework (methodology) | :: "criteria" (gates) | %clean/%lean (disable framework)

Chain resumption: chain_id + user_response (your step output).

parameters.command:
Prompt ID to expand with optional arguments. Format: >>prompt_id key="value".

Chains: >>step1 --> >>step2 (N-1 arrows for N steps).
Modifiers (place before ID): @Framework | :: "criteria" | %clean/%lean.

Do NOT invent IDs - use prompt_manager(action:"list") to discover valid prompts.
parameters.chain_id: Resume token (chain-{prompt} or chain-{prompt}#runNumber). RESUME: chain_id + user_response only. Omit command.
parameters.user_response: Your completed output from executing the previous step. Paste your work here when resuming a chain. Use with chain_id; do not include command when resuming.
parameters.gate_verdict: Gate review verdict with flexible format support. Primary: 'GATE_REVIEW: PASS|FAIL - reason'. Also accepts: 'GATE PASS - reason', 'GATE_REVIEW: FAIL: reason', 'PASS - reason' (minimal).
parameters.gate_action: User choice after gate retry limit exhaustion. 'retry' resets attempt count for another try, 'skip' bypasses the failed gate and continues, 'abort' stops chain execution entirely.

gates.description:
Quality gates for output validation. Three formats supported:

**1. Registered IDs** (strings): Use predefined gates like 'code-quality', 'research-quality'.

**2. Quick Gates** (RECOMMENDED for LLM-generated validation): `{name, description}` - Create named, domain-specific checks on the fly. Example: `{name: 'Source Quality', description: 'All sources must be official docs'}`.

**3. Full Definitions**: Complete schema with severity, criteria[], pass_criteria[], guidance for production workflows.

parameters.force_restart: Restart chain from step 1, ignoring cached state.

frameworkAware.enabled: üöÄ PROMPT ENGINE [FRAMEWORK]: Returns prompts with methodology guidance injected. You apply the methodology yourself.
frameworkAware.disabled: üöÄ PROMPT ENGINE: Returns prompts without methodology injection. Raw template expansion only.

prompt_manager.description:
üìù PROMPT MANAGER: Creates, updates, lists, and inspects prompt templates in the registry.

ACTIONS: create | update | delete | list | inspect | analyze_type | analyze_gates | reload | guide

Returns: Operation confirmation, prompt metadata, or action recommendations.

Use action:"list" to discover prompt IDs before using prompt_engine.

parameters.action: The operation to perform: create (new prompt), update (modify existing), delete (remove), list (discover IDs), inspect (view details), analyze_type/analyze_gates (get recommendations), reload (refresh from disk), guide (get action suggestions).
parameters.name: Human-friendly name (create/update).
parameters.execution_hint: Hint for execution type on creation.

frameworkAware.enabled: üìù PROMPT MANAGER [FRAMEWORK]: Guide recommendations reflect active methodology phases.
frameworkAware.disabled: üìù PROMPT MANAGER: Standard lifecycle operations without methodology context.

system_control.description:
‚öôÔ∏è SYSTEM CONTROL: Retrieves system status, switches frameworks, manages gates, and provides analytics.

ACTIONS: status | framework | gates | analytics | config | maintenance | guide

Returns: Current state, configurations, or operation confirmations.

parameters.action: The operation to perform: status (runtime overview), framework (switch/enable/disable methodologies), gates (manage quality gates), analytics (usage metrics), config (view/modify settings), maintenance (restart), guide (get recommendations).
parameters.operation: Sub-command for the selected action (e.g., framework switch/list/enable/disable; gates enable/disable/status/health/list).
parameters.framework: Target framework for switch operations (CAGEERF, ReACT, 5W1H, SCAMPER).
parameters.reason: Audit reason for framework/gate toggles or admin actions.
parameters.persist: When true, gate/framework enable/disable changes are also written to config.json.
parameters.search_query: Filter gates by keyword (matches ID, name, or description). Use with gates:list action.

frameworkAware.enabled: ‚öôÔ∏è SYSTEM CONTROL [FRAMEWORK]: Status includes active methodology context. Guide reflects current framework.
frameworkAware.disabled: ‚öôÔ∏è SYSTEM CONTROL: Standard system status without methodology context.
